intro: Calyptronoma rivalis, commonly known as the orchid orchid, is a species of flowering plant native to the wetlands of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that typically bloom in late summer. The plant has a sympodial growth habit, with each stem producing a cluster of leaves and flowers. Its roots are adapted to absorb nutrients from the waterlogged soils in which it thrives. Calyptronoma rivalis is often cultivated for its ornamental value in tropical gardens and greenhouses.
